column4: does someone knows why I am not allowed to modify /etc/resolv.conf? sudo echo "nameserver 195.113.0.2" > /etc/resolv.conf  - bash: /etc/resolv.conf: Permission denied
it has to do with the >, the sudo is only being applied to the first part
do sudo -s, then run the command without sudo
questionable legality, not that that means anything
